background of night photos taken while d: a dark or dimly lit sky with or without visible stars or the moon
blurred or motion-affected images of various objects on or beside the road, such as road, sidewalk, buildings, walls, fences, poles, traffic lights, traffic signs, vegetation, and other vehicles
a warm, yellow or orange glow from the lights of oncoming vehicles, or the dashboard of the vehicle the photo was taken in
road: a long, flat surface, often made of asphalt, concrete, or dirt
markings, such as lines or arrows, to guide traffic
a defined edge, such as a curb or shoulder
road signs, traffic signals, or other road-related features
a path or channel for vehicles to follow
surrounding environment, such as buildings, trees, or other terrain.
sidewalk: a flat, usually paved or concrete path
separated from the road by a curb or line
a distinctive line or color change from the road
wider than the road, often with more texture or pattern
may have pedestrian markings or accessibility ramps
usually have pedestrian traffic or street furniture such as benches, trash cans, or bike racks nearby
well-lit at night through streetlights or building lights
often adjacent to buildings or vegetation.
building: walls made of materials such as concrete, brick, glass, or metal
possibly with chimneys, vents, or antennas on the roof
may have outdoor lighting or signage
wall: made of materials like brick, concrete, stone, or wood
may have windows, doors, or other openings
may have a distinct texture or pattern
may be a part of a building or a standalone structure.
fence: made of metal, wood, or other materials
may have decorations or pointed tops
may be adjacent to a building, road, or other structures
typically has a defined edge or boundary
pole: often made of metal, wood, or concrete
may have a rounded or pointed top
may have brackets or attachments for holding items such as lights, signs, or cameras
sometimes has a base or foundation
tends to stand out against the surrounding environment due to its height and uniform shape.
traffic light: mounted on a vertical pole or suspended from a horizontal bar
usually positioned at an intersection or over a section of road
the circular or arrow-shaped lenses are typically the same size and ordered vertically or horizontally in a standard pattern (red at the top or left)
usually with a metal or plastic casing
traffic sign: rigid material such as metal or plastic
color of yellow, orange green or white or blue or red
vegetation: may be partially illuminated or casting shadows in night photos
may have flowers, fruits, or other distinguishing features
may be seen in clusters, groups, or as individual plants
terrain: natural features such as hills, mountains, or valleys
textures or patterns indicative of earth or soil
presence of vegetation or bare land
geological features such as rocks or water
sky: typically the large area at the top of the image
often darker in night photos due to lack of sunlight
can contain stars and a moon in a night photo
non-uniform areas of light or cloud cover in a night photo
a generally large, open, featureless space in a night photo
person: a head, torso, arms, and legs
a face with eyes, nose, and mouth
fingers on hands and toes on feet
a varying range of skin tones
possibly carrying objects such as a bag, phone, or umbrella
rider: a person seated on a vehicle
often sitting behind handlebars or holding onto the bike, motorcycle or other vehicles.
truck: larger size compared to a car
wheels with hubcaps or metal rims
tail lights and a license plate
side mirrors and a rearview mirror
bus: lights at the front and rear
a flat front with a forward-facing windshield
generally white, silver, yellow or various other colors
large size compared to an average vehicle
often a separate section for the driver
license plates at the front and rear
train: typically brown, grey, blue, or metal in color
windows and doors on the sides of the cars
headlamps or lights on the front and rear of the train
a locomotive or engine at the front or rear of the train
motorcycle: a wide profile with a narrow wheelbase
bicycle: Wheels have spokes or are solid
The bike may have a chain, lights, reflectors, or kickstand
A person may or may not be riding it
